title: “No Urgency” to Upgrade Vega C Booster, Says ESA
summary:
A shared solid-fuel booster upgrade that will be used for the first time aboard an Ariane 6 rocket later this year will not be introduced aboard Vega C until 2028. The European Space Agency says the delay reflects the requirements of the smaller rocket’s launch manifest and the need to prioritise early P160C production for […]
The post “No Urgency” to Upgrade Vega C Booster, Says ESA appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA says targeting ISS medical evacuation for January 14
summary:
Washington, United States (AFP) Jan 10, 2026


 NASA crewmembers aboard the International Space Station (ISS) could return to Earth as soon as Thursday, the US space agency said, after a medical emergency prompted the crew to return from their mission early.

title: Susan Schuh: Supporting the Humans in Human Spaceflight
summary: Susan Schuh has dedicated her career to helping humans adapt to life beyond Earth.   As the Flight Crew Integration Operational Habitability (OpsHab) team lead in NASA’s Human Health and Performance Directorate at Johnson Space Center in Houston, Schuh leads efforts to understand what it is really like to live and work in space. title: Kepler network to link OroraTech sensors for Earth monitoring
summary:
MILAN — OroraTech has entered a multi-year partnership with Kepler to supply thermal sensors for Kepler’s new optical communications constellation.  The first four SAFIRE Gen4 sensors under the agreement launched Jan. 11 aboard a Falcon 9, flying as part of the constellation’s initial deployment. “With Kepler, we are doing something completely new that will revolutionize […]

title: NASA astrophysics, commercial satellites launch on SpaceX rideshare mission
summary:
A SpaceX Falcon 9 launched a trio of NASA astrophysics small satellites along with dozens of commercial spacecraft on a rideshare mission Jan. 11.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 1st ‘Twilight’ rideshare mission
summary: The flight includes 40 deployment events for a variety of payloads, including NASA’s Pandora spacecraft. Liftoff from pad 4E is scheduled for 5:19 a.m. PST (8:19 a.m. EST / 1319 UTC).

title: Crew-11 to make early return Jan. 15
summary:
NASA plans to return four astronauts from the ISS to Earth early Jan. 15, about a week after one of them experienced a medical issue that prompted the shortened mission.
The post Crew-11 to make early return Jan. 15 appeared first on SpaceNews.
